title: General
stimulusHtml:
3 points maximum

The appeal to Aeneas' pietas in lines 4-6 (N.B Question does not require student to quote the Latin)

1 point - some understanding of pietas (directly stated or implied) as duty or obligation; more than English piety.

1 point - father/son connection

1 point - development/explanation that applies pietas to this particular situation -- reference to Ascanius' coming of age, the value of Ascanius as Aeneas' heir, and the idea that Ascanius' destiny is to rule Italy/Roman lands.
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the available points.
